I did notice that there aren't any call buttons like I have experienced at other similar luxury theaters. There didn't appear to be a mid-movie service either. 

I'd say the owner saw the yelp reviews & quickly took action because I just didn't experience the negatives that have been complained about over the last few months. I'll update when I get a chance to actually dine there.

Sitting at the bar with my wife and it smells like vomit. It smells so terrible we will no eat here and will not ever come back,
For t not being busy and for it so smell like this and have terrible service is beyond disgusting.

We were stay at the Coral Resort only 3 or so doors down so we decided to go her for breakfast. I loved the great selection of local and organic food. The atmosphere was very friendly and we got to talk to who I believe was the owner. The food was great, we got the steel cut oatmeal, poached egg on an English muffin, a bagel and a Clearwater sunset smoothie. All of which were very good, quality food. I unfortunately took off a star because we had to wait about 35 minutes for our food with only 2 other people in the café which seemed a little long to me. Overall I would definitely recommend it for the amazing food and friendly atmosphere.

I was surprised I liked Trident so much considering its a Seal bar and I'm an Army fan :) Love their all day happy hour on Sunday. Most 22oz draft beers are $3 during and they have some $3, $4 and $5 appetizers. The canteen is awesome... I love the horseradish dipping sauce! Their salads are really good as well. Every time I go I just end up getting a bunch of appetizers because there are so many tasty ones to choose from! Definitely a great menu, lots of drafts to choose from and a neat dive bar feel to it. Its a good place to go to before or after UA sporting events because you can walk to and from most of the games.

Simply awesome. Consistently great food--either breakfast or lunch.  The waitresses all are friendly and helpful.  I've visited the Frazer Diner about 100 times, and have never been disappointed.  All American diner food - nothing more, nothing less.

Now for those of you who enjoy waiting an hour plus for a seat on a Saturday or Sunday morning, and paying 2x the price you'd find at the Frazer Diner, please, please, please go join jeannine S at the Classic Diner.
If there was a negative star I'd use it. Bad service,  watery drinks, and dirty. Where's government regulations when you actually need it

The atmosphere was cool.  But the Veggie Burger was horrible.  I like veggie burgers.  In fact, I eat almost anything.  But even my friend that tried a bite of it spit hers out.  However, everything else was ok and I do want to give this place another shot (but ordering something completely different).  But I really hope they fix that veggie burger recipe.  
I also think that having only one bathroom on the first floor was weird considering the place was packed at lunch.

My family checked this place out in March. We were very disappointed. It is managed poorly. The staff is frazzled and have no idea what they are doing. The meat was very poor quality. It smelled like dog food and tasted about how you would imagine dog food to taste. They advertise on their website a kids meal including a choice of 4 main items plus a drink, cookie, coloring book and colors. On Monday night it's kids night where kids eat for $0.99. First they gave me only a taco and when I reiterated that it was a kid's meal they added a few stale tortilla chips and drink. I was going to let it slide until they charged me $3.29 for the kid's meal plus an additional $1.00 for (beef taco) the main item. I spoke to three different people including the franchise owner and not one was remotely apologetic. This place is terrible and I would advise that no one dine there.

This place was on my radar due to a lot of recommendations. We ate here last Sunday afternoon at around 12:20 PM. 

Since my fiancé and I had been exploring the area a bit, I was a little warm and wanted to dine inside. While dining inside shouldn't have been a big deal, what we didn't realize that after we were seated inside near the bar, we would not even be helped until 15-20 minutes after being seated. Everyone was seated outside at this time. I don't think our server even bothered to check inside. This was the first red flag. When the bartender asked if we had been helped, that was when our server came in and took our drink order. 

The Bloody Mary that I ordered wasn't even mixed, and my fiancé got the wrong beer. We thought about complaining, but we wanted to give more chances, since this place was highly recommended by others.

Apparently, there were only two cooks in the kitchen, so they were pretty backed up. A woman that was dining outside had complained to staff that their orders were taking forever. We just waited patiently and twiddled our thumbs. Our server never told us the status of our food and didn't seem friendly to us. We only overheard the delay from the bartender and the woman dining outside.

About 40 more minutes pass until a man who appeared to be in-charge asked us how we were doing. By this time, my fiancé and I have decided that if the food doesn't come in 10 minutes, we're leaving. It's ridiculous that an order of two veggie burgers takes about an hour to arrive. This man in-charge seemed pretty stressed and told us that he was going to make things happen in 10 minutes. He apologized about the delay and comped our food. This guy-in-charge is Broad Ripple Brewpub's saving grace.

Our food arrived. I ordered the Southwestern Veggie Burger that was supposed to come with salsa. It did not. However, at this point, my fiancé and I just wanted to eat. We were not going to complain since our food arrived. The burgers were nothing special, but it was decent for the price we paid.

This place didn't leave a good impression and we are not going back. We applaud the manager for dealing with the stressful situation of having only two cooks during the Sunday lunch hour. We left the bartender a little tip because she was the one who actually noticed we weren't helped before our server. I did not like our server. There seemed to be no shortage of servers, so there was no excuse to not even be helped after 15-20 minutes of being seated. She didn't even offer us waters. I really wish that the tips didn't go to her and that they went to the bartender, the manager, and the cooks that were struggling.

Unexpected excellence!  We had the Seaweed salad, miso soup, rock shrimp, spicy maki combo, the daily special crazy spider roll, and the waitress-recommended chestnut roll, and because we were hungry, added the shrimp mei fun.   Everything was so good!   We brought our own wine (an Albariño).   The mei fun had fresh crunchy bean sprouts, the specialty rolls were fabulous.  Generous amounts of ginger and wasabi.  And we brought home half the mei fun, and half of both specialty rolls.  We devoured and tried everything else.  I wish I could get more of the seaweed salad!  Pleasant atmosphere.  Thank you with kudos to the chef.
Did a fantastic job with my Chanel bag. Excellent service with quick response time. Worth every penny and highly recommend!

Dude. It's not just a Target. It's a Super Target. How 'bout that? Heading to your first year at IUPUI or UIndy? This is way closer than IKEA. Just saying. We still desperately need one downtown, but until then, this may be easier than schlepping to Glendale.

I literally wish I could give this place a zero. This was possibly the worst dining experience I've ever had. Honestly, we did have warning bells go off when we turned in to the parking lot, which previously was so full, we'd have to park all the way in the back, today was ridiculously empty. 

Our host was pleasant enough. But then came our waiter. He couldn't seem to get our order right. Even while writing in his little notepad. He kept asking us the same questions over and over again. My friend and I both ordered off the Amore Monday menu ($15.99 for the sirloin, an appetizer -I ordered the meatballs, she ordered the calamari, and we both chose Caesar salads). 

This is where it gets a little shifty. Our waiter came out with a receipt (two $15.99 meals, and two $2.59 for drinks), pointed out a series of numbers in the middle of the receipt and told us that if we went online and filled out the survey, we would get free dessert and he would take extra good care of us. Being the trusting idiot that I am, I told him I'd do it, which I did, and gave him and the store the best scores possible. There was a new creme brûlée cheesecake that I wanted to try. Didn't seem like a bad deal. 

Our apps came out (20 minutes apart, mind you, but we didn't think it was a big deal). Then our Caesar salads came out (she had all hearts while I had all leaves, and both of us had no croutons at all, but again, no big deal). Then our steaks came out. This is where things really started falling apart. As my friend and I started cutting in to our steaks, blood was spurting out. Our steaks were completely red in the middle. She had ordered hers medium rare, so she was able to continue eating, even though it was completely rare. I, on the other hand, ordered mine medium well. I tried taking a bite to see if I'd be able to stomach it. I couldn't. It felt like I was eating raw meat. I decided to send it back to get cooked a bit more, which wouldn't be too bad, if our waiter hadn't gone MIA for a good 25 minutes. I even heard the table across from us ask another waiter where their waiter (same as ours) had gone. It's also worth it to say that this whole time our drinks were completely empty and hadn't been tipped off once. By anyone. When our waiter miraculously re-emerged, I told him about my steak, which he agreed to bring back to the kitchen. By the time my food had come back out, my friend had finished her whole meal. Again my steak wasn't cooked as medium well, but at least it wasn't completely red in the middle anymore so I just sucked it up and ate it. 

At this point, our waiter puts a dish with the most unsavory looking gelato on the table. He says its for filling out the survey. I explained to him that the way he had worded it earlier, he made it seem as if we would be able to pick our own dessert. He said, nope, this is what you get for filling out the survey. Now I'm feeling a little cheated. I took the time to fill out their survey and gave them the best possible scores, and the only thing I got out of it was crappy service and melted awful gelato (that we couldn't eat, it tasted so bad). But I told myself it was my fault for not being more specific and asking him more about it. We ask for the check and I mention that I have a 20% off coupon that I got in the mail. 

Tell me why our meals, which we know are $15.99 each, and were charged at $15.99 on the first receipt (that he brought out when he wanted us to fill out the survey), had now been changed to $17.99 each. At this point I'm starting to lose my patience, but I stayed polite. I called him over and calmly asked why we were being charged $17.99. He said it was because we had sauce on our steaks. When I told him it's clearly written in the menu that it's included in the price, he mumbled some other nonsense then loudly called over the manager to come deal with us. When the manager came over I asked the same question, and he replied that it's because we had fettuccine Alfredo as our sides. I told him no one told us it was an extra charge. He said no big deal and he'd fix it. 10 minutes later the receipt comes back out with only one of the meals at $15.99. I tried telling the waiter about this again at which point he started catching an attitude with me, which was completely undeserved as I was completely civil with him. He snatches the ticket of the table, comes back 5 minutes later, slams it on the table and leaves. My friend ended up paying with cash because we didn't even wanna stay there long enough to wait for a card to come back. And she left him over a 20% tip, because, again, we didn't wanna wait there any longer than we had to. As we were leaving, there was the manager standing at the podium with a host and hostess eying us as we were walking towards the door. Obviously didn't even try to hide the fact that they were talking about us. 

TLDR: worst experience ever. Don't eat here. Service is crap. Food is crap. Never coming back.

Absolutely awful.  Ordered wings for the Super Bowl.  Was assured it was no problem to have the order ready for 5:30 pickup.  After an HOUR wait, the wings were not even cooked completely.  Tasted as if they were boiled, not fried.  And, they tried to charge my son for ranch and celery!  Really?  Last time.  Too many other places to get wings.
Amazing food!!! Looks like a hole in the wall kind of place but those are always the hidden gems. The stuff the tacos, so i was full off of three! They were quick and efficient. Loved it!
This place hits the spot on every note. Strong coffee, delicious biscuits, & perfect NOLA atmosphere. Love it.

Amazing service, friendly movers. 

After browsing several moving options in the area, Green Truck was by far the least expensive.  This low price does not reflect in their services, however.  Movers were quick, and took precautions by padding the walls and doorway, as well as carefully wrapping up delicate items/furniture.  

$25 for Vandy students doesn't hurt, either :)

We were in NOLA in October 2012 for a convention, and spent a good bit of time walking around the French Quarter, like the rest of the folks who come to NOLA. While I am no big fan of the Bourbon Street experience, I always find that there are great places to visit in the area, and never 'throw the baby out with the bathwater...'

While walking around the area, we decided to pop into Muriel's for a quick lunch after exploring the Quarter. After walking by too many junk and trinket shops, we needed a place that would be able to seat us quickly and allow us to placate our 3 year old. 

The staff was very friendly, the decor was quaint, and the food came quickly and was well-prepared. The vegetarian medley plate was absolutely superb - a nice change from the heavier non-vegetarian entrees we indulged in all week! The crab and shrimp salad was crisp and properly portioned.

The wait staff was very polite, and were helpful when our silly little one decided that flipping over in her chair would be a great idea - while she was busy shrieking, they rapidly brought a nice plate of ice cream that made her forget her fear of falling - way to go, guys!

Overall, a very nice impromptu experience while in the French Quarter without breaking the bank or making us wait forever for a table. Merci à bientôt!

This place loses 2 stars from me. an hour for delivery when I live right around the corner?..i ordered spaghetti and meatballs...wet thin noodle with terrible watery red sauce and the meat were clearly bought from the frozen food section at save a lot. It had ZERO taste and I had to throw it out. Step up the quality of your food.

Quick friendly service. Dan, who rescued me when I locked my car keys in the trunk of my car, was very friendly and he arrived in 15 maybe 20 minutes had me in my car with in 10 minutes. Definitely will use alpine again.

This SOHO contessa was spending her fifth year wedding anniversary at Clearwater Beach. A group decided to go to Shepard's. The tall dark guy standing at the window checked everyone's ID and we then we proceeded to the bar. The bar, seeing we were classy ol' folk served us and then asked for a wrist-band. 

Long story short: the guy at the window said"I knew u wood be back" he let us leave without bands to be a dick! We kept our classy cool. Then, the security walked us out rudely. No need....this SOHO Queen has better. So trashy! I was with gorgeous company, so odd for them to be so aggressive. 

I've never. Heathens. I need a spa treatment stat- I'm going to Sand Pearl where I belong!

We live in Venice Beach and only come to Philadelphia once a year so this is our first experience of High Point after it transitioned from Mugshot and we are very pleased to be able to have a lovely, delicious, low-key and comfortable neighborhood coffee shop. My latte was delicious with lots of foam. The barista was very welcoming, especially since we're from out of town.  I will certainly return.

Noboru Sushi Buffet. The best steak they gilled there, medium rare, juicy with original favor taste when you spilt pepper and salt.  Korean owners run Japanese sushi buffet that gilled best western steak!!!!
The service is great, the difference between other sushi buffet, you got most attention and best care. usually you go to buffet restaurant, you always have poor service. Noboru give you the great foods and best service.

I don't write many review on Yelp but I was very impressed with Rittenhouse hardware on my latest trip to pick-up a few things today. I anticipated a wait + bit of an hassle to shop around on a Saturday afternoon. However, these guys know what they are doing. They are well-staffed on busier days and I've always seen at least one person on the floor + one at the counter even on a week day, which means you're not wandering around aimlessly looking for supplies. Within moments of walking in, I had my random list of items from door knobs to pepper spray (which was an awesome surprise since I had no clue where to find that stuff). 

Overall, they make the most of their prime location but somewhat smaller space (in comparison to an Ace or Walmart that is) with great  employees that know what they're doing + a great variety of products that are main-stays for fixes and home improvements. As a novice to changing locks and using Spackling walls, they kind of made my afternoon. Kudos to management and to your awesome team!

Seriously, this spot is dead-on fantastic!! We had impeccable service; Establishment was *imnaculate; Food unbelievably fresh & delicious!! Our Chef was so personalized to needs @ our *Hot Grill*! He sang, cooked and just overall made everyone's experience special We had a couple of Cocktails (Mudslide & the most perfect Mai-Tai) I've drank in a while. Great pours! Dinner was *Trios* for me w/Lobster, Shrimp & Scallops. Mignon/Scallops. Biggest Sea Scallops ever. Meat was so tender you could cut w/a fork if ya needed to!  Seafood so fresh. Now, this came w/Soup, or Salad; Egg Fried Rice; Mixed grilled Veggies w/Mushrooms & Noodles. WHEW!! ALLOT! You most likely will need a *To-Go* box as everyone did @ our table. This is a dining experience, not your run-of-the-mill. Total=$171 w/TIP.  
4- Cocktails, California Roll & 2 Dinners! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this  restaurant.!! I will be back & would like to say, "Thank You" to entire Staff. Finally got exactly what I want to pay for. EXCELLENCE

Remember when Tyson Bee's first came out, before the disappointing change in management, and everyone was raving about its crazy food truck innovation and tremendous fusion of flavors??

Well, THIS is the new THAT.

I've never had anything quite like the food here. It's a little bit Thai, a little bit Mexican, and one hundred percent amazing. The Cap'n Crunch crusted tilapia burrito is one of those masterpieces that hinders me from keeping entirely vegetarian. Its subtle sweetness works perfectly with the spicy sauce, huge avocado chunks, and crisp greens. The veggie burger is also solid, and the curries all look fantastic.

This would totally be a fiver in my book if it weren't for the painfully long wait time. Since the food is so darn good, I might be able to forgive this, but the way they taunt you with incredibly tantalizing aromas is just cruel.

While driving down 1 over the weekend, I stopped in a bunch of random beach towns, checking out local businesses and eating as much of the local favorites as time and stomach capacity could allow. By the time I hit Santa Barbara,  I decided that my experience would not be marked by a memorable meal, but by a new piercing.

I hopped on Yelp, and thanks to my fellow Yelpers, I discovered Golden Eagle Tattoo. Situated on bustling State street, next to an adult bookstore, Golden Eagle has an exceptionally inviting vibe, with its open front and casual vibe. I was quickly directed upstairs, where he piercings were done.

I was greeted by a casual, yet professional guy, named Johnny, who promptly introduced himself, asking for my name and remembering it through my visit. (Nice touch, especially when I have pre-piercing butterflies.)

I got the cuff of my left ear pierced with a small hoop, a piercing that I have had before, but let close. The piercing room was very clean, with instruments packages from the autoclave. There was an emphasis on cleanliness and sterility- always comforting in a piercing studio.

With a one, two count and a few deep breaths, the piecing was done, before it began with little to no pain. It looks awesome and is healing nicely.

Overall this has been my best piercing experience, and it is a shame I live so far away, because I would go again the next time I want something pierced.

Thanks Johnny!

This is a pretty good place to get a last minute mani or pedi. There are tons of great pros but also some cons.

PROS: they do have some great technicians but others are pretty bad and you really have to know who to ask for otherwise your experience could be black and white. They do follow pretty good covid sanitation from what I can see. The receptionist is friendly and knowledgeable (Jody). They have hundreds of nail colors to choose from and gel manicures can be done during your lunch hour if you are trying to squeeze in a service. They offer aesthetic services too although I've not gotten any of those. The pedicure chairs have good back massagers built in. It is likely you can book an appointment for you and a friend or even 3 of you. 

CONS: twice now, I've had a nail technician (during a pedicure) drop an instrument on the floor and pick it up and continue to use it on me. This really is the biggest reason for star loss in my opinion. My nail polish on my toes also only typically lasts 10-12 days before mayor chipping. Not sure if it's the brand they use but my pedis at other places in town last 30 days without chipping. They do use pedicure chairs which they line with plastic but it does have a shared plumbing so I always kinda worry about how sanitary that is. I have come here enough that I know the price of the service I'm getting but I've heard some customers get confused at checkout and not understand what some of their up charges are for. They also recently instituted a mandatory $2 charge for your own nail kit you get to take home (nail file and buffers). They explained that they don't make any money off this charge and it is simply bc they have had a harder time getting supplies. I go to other nail salons in town and have not heard them say they are having difficulties getting disposable supplies. It is quite possible although I just feel a bit odd with the long story of how they go on and on about "not making any money on these". 

Will I go back? Somewhat very likely bc it's easy to get a last minute appointment and worth it if I can get a technician I know does good work and I will be more vocal about stopping them from using dropped equipment. Is it a spa like experience? No although the decor is lovely and the prices are reasonable if you make sure to know what you are asking for and getting before booking. They have service menus, just ask. Also ask how much things will be if you are asking for additional services like nail designs or deluxe pedicures.

I was not able to check in for some reason but the hubs and I went to this new location last night for the first time.  First impression - they need more parking.  The parking was ridiculous and there were more cars having to park in grass lots across the street than in the actual parking lot.  Its a brand new location so the inside is nice and clean with everything being new.  But because it is new - it was packed! We waited for over 30 minutes for a table inside.  It was just too hot for us to take the option of outdoor seating.  I was worried that our food would take forever since they were so packed, but amazingly, our food came out SUPER FAST, correct and was very good.  I had the honey mustard chicken sandwich with fries, the hubs had blackened wings and we had the jalapeno poppers as an app.  Everything was very good.

I experience food from this restaurant at the Convention Center.  The line was out into the venue so I thought it must be good.  I had the chicken wings with the rice and greens.  There was no option to substitue for the oka or two green vegetables.  They ran out of some items in the interim and I was given a double green instead.  The greens were terrible.  I would like the chief to know the friend chicke was good but it could have used some lemon pepper or creole seasoning.  Overall I will not return to this restaurant on my next trip.

I was visiting NOLA when I had a flat. I called NTB and spoke to a young man who told me he would take care of my tire the next morning. He had it in stock. True to his word he was there waiting for me at 7:00 this morning. He fixed me up in time to get to my meeting. He was knowledgeable and kind. I can not say enough about the customer service. Thanks for getting me on the road!

The Earl is a nice spot to grab a sandwich before your flight or even to take it along. I have visited this location a coupe of times and they have taken care of me quickly and efficiently. 

Not a whole lot to say other than if you are looking for a good sandwich at the Philly airport, give these guys a try.
Seriously the best pizza in the Treasure Valley.  They do an incredible job that is consistent.  Do yourself a favor and try this pizza!

Food was excellent, though portions are rather small. Place can get very busy on a weekend. Called ahead to make a birthday reservation, and only later was told right in front of my guest about a $10 surcharge for a birthday fee. It wasn't explained to me well, and the timing of the request was poor, so I declined. Then the manager intervened and told us more about it, and I let them go with it. They turned the radio and lights off, and present a spectacular display. I enjoyed the food and was glad to be able to sample their sushi with BYOB and BYO dessert. I plan on returning sometime when they are less busy and see if this will help achieve faster service.

Do not go another day in your life with out stopping into this carnivores paradise! Alex's has been around foreverrr and it is for obvious reasons. I highly recommend the pulled pork sandwich, ribs, Mac n cheese, onion rings, cole slaw, beans....umm yeah pretty much everything. All I'm saying is when you smell the smokey gold rolling out of Alex's firepit while at the ehrlich and west village light don't just keep going, pull in!
Terrible.  Made us get out of the taxi at airport because we weren't going far enough.  Everyone in line was appalled.  Could not have been more rude or more arrogantly

Have to agree with other reviewer Tampa bike share maintenance seems to be badly lacking as of late.I use bike every day as part of my commute to work and it is getting harder to find a working bike ,when there are multiple bikes on the racks.Platt st. In front of publix many times has only 2 bikes at station and both have been broken for weeks now! Convention center usually  has more non working bikes than working ones.Harbor Island  the same.Love the ability of using a bike just wish I was able to do it more often when needed. Step it up Coast Bike Share....Please!

The Knitting Factory is legit as far as I'm concerned.  Went to see the Gabba Gabba Heys last night, and they were pretty decent.  I'm guessing this is an all ages venue, judging by the fact that there were little kids in the mosh pit.  It has concrete floors, so if you're all old and have back problems get the reserved seats.  I wouldn't recommend them otherwise, as they seem to be in a crappy location, and you pay over double regular admission price.  The bar is pretty standard, overpriced beers and all (six bucks for one Newcastle?).  One handy feature is the coat check, just bring a couple bucks and they will hang your business up.  Overall, a great venue with better sound than the GSR theater.

Where do I even begin?  My love for this place runs deep. Whatever you are in the mood for, Mazzaro's has it and it's going to be amazing. The sandwiches from their to-go counter are delicious. The Asiago stuffed gnocchi you can grab at the pasta counter will change your life. If you like amaretto pick up an amaretto ball from their dessert counter. I don't think I've ever gone without having their spicy soppressata stocked in my fridge. The two gentleman that work in the wine section are always so friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable.  If you are going to splurge on food, this is the place to do it.
Very solid dealership! Buy a car from Lou Fusz
This is one of my favorite pho place! The kimchee burger is good too! Recommend to come on weekdays, because on weekends this place is always pack.

Cool bar. Great atmosphere and comfortable leather chairs. Had a drink here only but the menu and food looked great. Service was friendly and we were waited on very fast. Cool place to hang out with a group of friends.

Went here for the great food I had experienced before. 
After HORRIBLE service, flagging down the waitresses, & being told they were out of all drinks except alcohol & water, my friends and I left leaving cash at the table to cover our tabs but did not tip. The staff proceeded to call my boyfriend a nigger & follow my friend outside threatening to call the cops.  I was disappointed in the wait staff but their intolerance & bigotry will definitely prevent me from ever going back.
Absolutely delicious. I don't get seafood for breakfast but the Oyster Benedict was amazing. As was the coffee.

Great selection of craft beers on tap,the service is so so. Sometimes they are awesome other times it's brutal. .30cents for a sample that they offer you is bad customer service as well. I have been to Underground a few times but with other craft beer locations available my trips to this place will be less frequent.

Just had such an amazing experience here! Got a full cut- so a consultation, wash, cut, and styling. My stylist was Kristen and she was super cool, knowledgeable, and had a great sense of humor! Everyone was very positive, real, and welcoming. My hair looks a million times better than when I walked in, and I am confident it will grow well. I will surely be coming back here in the future. Love a salon that is both down to earth, and makes you feel special. So happy to have found a local salon I can make my go to! Update: it's been over a month and I'm still obsessed with my cut! Grateful for someone who can cut curly/wavy hair and have it look great with just air drying. Literally have to do nothing!
Try the creamy grits, tell are really good. Under the sea omelette was a new take on the omelette and better than a standard omelette.
We had some repairs done to our roof by Hallmark. They we very fast and completely professional.

Get one of these and you'll be drunk while also not putting a dent in your pocket. 10 dollars when you first purchase and $7 dollar refill. As long as you keep the container you can keep the $7 deal "for life "as the sales women said.

Four stars is an adequate rating of this establishment.   While the food is excellent, the ambience and service can be overwhelming.  I found myself constantly distracted by the rants the cashier would go on to each customer.  My Cuban was very good.

I went to Crazy Sushi for dinner last night for the second time.  This is a great place to go to if you are looking for some good and creative sushi in Philadelphia.  The restaurant is BYOB which is a plus.  

My boyfriend and I ordered the gyoza to start and four special rolls - Crunch Kani Roll, Ichiban Roll, M16 Roll and France Roll.  The France Roll is my favorite roll at Crazy Sushi.  All the rolls were presented together very nicely on one large plate with a few decorations.  I highly recommend making reservations for dinner on the weekends as it is usually packed.

A young man from Nothing Bundt Cakes came into the business where I work today and asked how many employees we had working, I told him 25 and he then proceeded to give us 28 mini Bundt cakes. I asked him why and he said they were out giving cakes away in hopes of earning our business in the future. They were absolutely amazing and when we have events or need sweets we will definitely be calling them! Great PR and great cakes!
Restaurant looks extremely dirty and food is about average.   Waited an hour for my food.

Did the 5 in 1 tour tonight!! LOVED it!! We were a party of 6, Michael was our tour guide, he did a FANTASTIC job. Kept everyone's attention (even my 9 year old son) and kept us all wanting to hear more. 

This is our 3rd trip to N.O. And each time we come we do the tour (different companies.). This has been the best one by far! Highly recommend!

Located right between the Gateway Arch and the Old Courthouse, very conveniently near to everything downtown. Busch Stadium is just a few blocks away as well.

On our first night, we were given a room that was less then adequate, with virtually no view. The plumbing, we learned later, was leaking down to the room below us every time we flushed our toilet. After finally being notified by maintenance, that this was going on at around 11:30 PM, we were soon reassured that they now had everything under control. But by morning, there was frantic knocking at our door and we were asked to relocate to another room, ASAP; rather gruffly. I had to set a couple of the maintenance guys straight that if they hadn't fixed the problem the night before, though reassuring us that it was under control, that I didn't appreciate their attitude now. Needless to say, their demeanors soon changed to a much more polite and pleasant "yes sir", "sorry sir". Our next room was a much more pleasant upgrade. Don't take my meekness for weakness!

But overall, a fairly nice stay...in spite of a few mishaps.

Good food, great service and beautiful view of sunset & the city at night! 
The server got a great sense of humor. We got lobster, pork chop, filet mignon and seafood tower. All was delicious.

Best crab cake sandwich I've ever had. Period. Simple fresh ingredients on a bun so soft and pillowy I just wanted to crawl in and go to sleep in it. I'm staying at the doubletree across the street and could eat here everyday. The second time I went I had the shrimp salad with big fresh pieces of shrimp in a zippy mayo dressing. Yum!

Despite all the hype, I felt Dave's Dogs were severely overrated. The previous reviews were not off-point when saying the hot dogs were good, but they were not the best hot dogs I've ever tasted.

During my visit, I tried Dave's Style and the SB Style. Both were solid in that the ingredients looked fairly fresh and it was well-cooked. However, given its price, it easily could've been a Costco hot dog (which is bigger) with additional condiments placed on top. 

Thus, taking into account the price, hype and execution, I felt that Dave's Dogs are beneficiaries of a strange bandwagon effect. Tldr; Good hot dogs, but overpriced and overhyped.

Went there today for our first time. Food and beer was great. Finally a place that not only offers Bavarian beer! Germany does have many more kinds of beer to offer!!! But please!!!!! Get the Kölsch Stangen! The original glasses for Kölsch. It doesn't taste the same in a Bavarian Bierkrug. 

BTW: a Döner is definitely a good that most German eat, but don't forget: it's Turkish. Maybe you can add some more original German food one day. 
But your Döner sandwich is definitely the best I've had here in Florida so far. Great job! 

Will definitely come back.

Great atmosphere.  Went for an opening on Friday night.  There was art, wine and appetizers. 

The wine was good. The glass sticky and with white spots (assuming towel residue). It didn't help that the young lady serving was holding the glass by the top where my lips we supposed to go. Anyway,  I asked for another clean glass of (yes FREE wine ) and this is were it got weird.  The lady serving obviously got upset and ugly in her " there you go DEAR!"

OH DEAR. oh well.  

Too bad. The petite cheese croissants were absolutely delicious.  
the art is ok. the crowd very Clayton indeed.

I make at least one trip to Haslam's during the winter month I vacation near St. Petersburg. The prices on previously-owned books are a little higher than some used-book stores.  But the combination of new and used under one roof is convenient.  Haslam's is a local institution and I hope it stays around forever.

The food is definitely good. Do I think that it's worth the prices attached to it? Not really. I think that for the price, I expected something spectacular about the burger that I ordered and the burger was good, just not extraordinary. The space is cute - very narrow and a little tight so not good for large groups. We ended up sitting at the bar, which was perfect for catching up with a friend. I hear the duck fat fries are good (I personally don't really see the hype), but I will tell you that the brioche bun the burgers are served on are pretty great. I would recommend for lunch, if you can get there before it's too crowded.

Lots of deliciously greasy food for really cheap, and really cheap beer...a pitcher of Dos Equis is about $6 I think. In addition to being cheap and greasy, the food is actually really good...not as authentic as the holes in the wall on Cherokee, but easily the best you'll find anywhere else in the city.

This was only my second time at a Texas Roadhouse but was very pleased with the food and service. As expected it was packed on a Friday night so we got a beer and a wine at the bar and ate peanuts in the waiting area. We were seated within 20 minutes and were lucky to have Max as our server. He was super friendly.  The food was great had a Pittsburgh style ribeye cooked perfectly and my dining companion had a filet which he said was excellent . The bread the salad and sides (loved the seasoned rice) were all  very tasty.  I will definitely return
Purchased chicken salad with pecans and grapes, pecan tart & rolls. Everything I put in my mouth was scrumptious. I also noticed they sell local honey. I would highly recommend visiting.
